learning_outcomes.description: Read and translate into English general authentic texts in Modern Standard Chinese with the aid of a dictionary.
Read both simplified and traditional Chinese characters at the advanced level.
Improve general writing skills in Chinese to the advanced level or above.
Gain better knowledge and understanding of Chinese language.
Demonstrate respect for cultural and social diversity and for Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples and perspectives.
Demonstrate knowledge and respect for ethics and ethical standards in completing assessment tasks.
Lead self and others in group activities.
Be confident dealing with ambiguity and uncertainty.
Present persuasive oral and written arguments.
Be empathetic of other people, cultures, and knowledge systems.

assessments.task_description:
In-class exam on L6, L7, L8 and other materials covered in class. The exam is comprised of two tasks: character writing and essay writing. The character writing focuses on words learned from each lesson. The essay writing focuses on using the rhetorical styles and other writing skills we have discussed in class.

This assessment task is designed to enhance students’ ability to communicate with cultural sensitivity and engage thoughtfully in discussions on key issues relevant to both Australian and Chinese workplace contexts. Intercultural (Australia vs. China) and intracultural (indigenous perspectives) examples will be discussed and provided in class to help students prepare for the assessment. 

AI and MT Statement

This assessment task is to be completed in-person. The use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT) tools will not be permitted. Any attempted use of AI or MT may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: In person exam. Hand in paper before the exam ends.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.late_submission: You will receive a mark of 0 if this assessment is submitted late.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

assessments.task_description:
Exam on L9, L10, L11 and other materials covered in class. The exam is comprised of two tasks: character writing and essay writing. The character writing focuses on words learned from each lesson. The essay writing focuses on using the rhetorical styles and other writing skills we have discussed in class.

This assessment task is designed to enhance students’ ability to communicate with cultural sensitivity and engage thoughtfully in discussions on key issues relevant to both Australian and Chinese workplace contexts. Intercultural (Australia vs. China) and intracultural (indigenous perspectives) examples will be discussed and provided in class to help students prepare for the assessment. 

Examination period: TBA after publication of Central Exams timetable.

AI and MT Statement

This assessment task is to be completed in-person. The use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT) tools will not be permitted. Any attempted use of AI or MT may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Students must hand in paper before the exam ends.
